abstract: New York Gov Andrew M Cuomo moves to revive housing program known as 421-a, which expired in January 2016, by offering unions and real estate developers set construction wage rates for government-assisted rental housing projects in Manhattan, Brooklyn and Queens; program had led to thousands of apartments being built for low- and moderate-income families around New York City, and saved property owners millions of dollars in property taxes.

headline.print_headline: Cuomo Moves to Revive a Housing Aid Program
headline.main: Cuomo Moves to Revive a Dormant Housing Aid Program

keywords.value: Real Estate Board of New York
keywords.name: organizations

snippet: The program, which expired in January, generated thousands of apartments for poor and moderate-income New Yorkers....
lead_paragraph: The program, which expired in January, generated thousands of apartments for poor and moderate-income New Yorkers.
